title: Share with access to electricity vs. per capita energy consumption
subtitle: Having access to electricity is defined in international statistics as having an electricity source that can provide very basic lighting, and charge a phone or power a radio for 4 hours per day. [Primary energy](#dod:primaryenergy) is measured in [kilowatt-hours](#dod:watt-hours) per person, using the [substitution method](#dod:substitutionmethod).

display.name: Share of the population with access to electricity
